intro: Eurostorhiza urvillei, commonly known as the Urville's starwort, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, star-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Eurostorhiza urvillei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
